'Nickel(II) chloride' (or just 'nickel chloride'), is the chemical compound
NiCl 2. The anhydrous salt is yellow, but the more familiar hydrate
NiCl 2Â·6H 2O is green. It is very rarely found in nature as
mineral nickelbischofite. A dihydrate is also known. In general nickel(II)
chloride, in various forms, is the most important source of nickel for chemical
synthesis. Nickel salts are carcinogenic. They are also deliquescent, absorbing
moisture from the air to form a solution.
